intro: Trollius pulcher, commonly known as the showy goldenroot, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant features a short, stout stem that rises from a rhizomatous root system, and its leaves are deeply lobed with a rough texture. Trollius pulcher thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is often found in alpine meadows. Its medicinal properties have been historically recognized, though it contains toxic compounds that require careful handling.
